subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's box on TV last night
author: juli velazquez
full_text:
--0-1162350096-1204142796=:59131

--0-674866866-1204142796=:59131
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Lorraine is a doll.  I love talking with her.  I interviewed her for one of my books.  She is very much a character.  
   
  Juli

")0( Scarlet Raging Storm INHA" <ladychrissyleo@...> wrote:
                    I did to I adore Lorainne Warren. I think that it is good they discuss demons they are around us as I am finding out. 
  Hugs
  Chrissy 
   
    -------Original Message-------
   
    From: Frank Ratka
  Date: 02/27/2008 1:01:22 PM
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's box on TV last night

   
    Because by contract PSR has to use the word demon on each episode (J/J). The name alone gets people interested, scared and so on. LOL Oh, I love Lorainne Warren's method of removing Chip from a trance. She slapped the shit out of him. he he hehe I almost fell over! You could hear the sarcastic "thank you" from Chip. LMFAO

Regards,

Frank R.

  ----- Original Message ----
From: LC Duplatt <lcdupla@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, February 27, 2008 10:13:24 AM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's box on TV last night

    Yes, the old "demon chasing" crap, once again. 

I brought the following thought up elsewhere and will bring it up 
here for consideration, too. If ghosts are coming through the box 
and thus are not in a good state of mind, how come on Paranormal 
State CM was willing to believe the message given by the ghost via 
the box as being truth (The ghost via the box said a "demon" was 
holding the ghosts captive there)? 

I would suggest that perhaps a ghost (assuming we are talking about a 
disembodied person who remains earthbound) is not in a healthy state 
of mind one would consider "stable," but trapped in emotional trauma 
of some sort. Thus, how reliable could the message of a ghost then 
be? ;)

LC

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "wgungfu" <wgungfu3@.. .> wrote:
>
> Don't know if anyone caught it, but Frank's box was used on last
> night's episode of Paranormal State on A&E. They were investigating
> an old insane asylum, and they had Chris Moon as a guest 
investigator
> with the box. You can see the promo clip here:
> 
> http://www.pennstat eprs.com/ ps_asylum. mov
> 
> Here's the site for the show itself:
> 
> http://www.aetv. com/paranormal- state/index. jsp
> 
> For those not familiar, its a half hour show that follows along the
> "Penn State Paranormal Research Society" and different cases they 
take
> on. Their niche in the "paranormal reality tv show" market is that
> the group's leader follows a more Christian orientated skew on
> happenings. Lots of "demons" (they have Lorraine Warren guest all 
the
> time), and they usually try to do investigations/ communication only
> during what they call "dead time", 3am-4am, or "the polar opposite 
of
> 3pm - the time Jesus gave is life for all mankind" as they put it. 
Oh,
> and they have an "occult specialist" on the team that so far has 
been
> anything but.
> 
> On the positive side, they did actually get (and record for later
> analysis) live communication on the box in response to questions 
being
> asked. And on the analysis and isolation of the recorded parts, you
> could actually hear what was being said (as opposed to the usual of
> Chris acting as a go-between for very distorted sounds like on those
> youtube videos). So it was good to see it a)working in the "field"
> and b)get some exposure on a tv show.
> 
> 
> Marty
>
